title.narrative: QUALITY AND EQUITABLE NUTRITION SERVICES

description.narrative: Law on Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH), immunization policy rosschecking of DRR policy documents, training and commodities to mitigate dzud and drought impact, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged children in Mongolia benefit from increased access to and utilization of services that promote health and nutrition, including Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and interventions that mitigate the impact of air pollution on child survival.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Law on MNCH, immunization policy rosschecking of DRR policy documents, training and commodities to mitigate dzud and drought impact

description.narrative: The first ever bachelor's degree programme for nutritionist and dietitian in health sector rolled out from 2019, greatly improving capacity of human resources in nutrition area. Government endorsed integration of the BFHI assessment and monitoring into the hospital accreditation system and standards of fortified flour and salt. National and subnational capacity for promoting and educating school children on healthy eating and physical activity enhanced. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Community health workers trained with UNICEF support to provide infant and young child feeding counselling services in the reporting year

target.value: 2021:at least 60% of the primary health workers in focus areas

title.narrative: Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received IYCF counselling and messages through facility, community outreach, social media and other communication channels with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
Percentage of children aged 05 months exclusively breastfed.
Existence of national protocols for the management of SAM based on WHO standards

actual.value: 2018:National protocol on integrated management of acute malnutrition has been finalized and the national capacities are enhanced to enable health services to provide up to standardised approaches on integrated management of acute malnutrition.

title.narrative: Adoption of the International Code on Marketing of Breastmilk substitutes as legislation and subsequent relevant World Health Assembly resolutions

target.value: 2021:Score 5: Many provisions in law and the existence of a designated body for carrying out ongoing monitoring

actual.value: 2020:The Code monitoring checklist is approved by the General Inspection Agency in 2019 and the implementation of the Code is being monitored accordingly.
